title: Decimomannu Roman bridge
description: The remains of a stone, arched Roman bridge at Decimomannu, to the west of Assemini, Sardinia. Three of the original six arches survive today. The bridge may originally have been as much as 160 meters in length. R.J. Rowland considered it to be of Iulio-Claudian date.

properties.description: Representative location of the remains of the Roman bridge based on a way derived from OpenStreetMap.
properties.title: OSM location of Ponte romano
